page.title: 03River Hamble again....
page.content:
& designers, sail makers, riggers, chandlers, and 'Hamble Inshore Rescue Service',providing everything any sailor could need. These facilities attract yachtsmen all over the country including celibrities such as Ted Heath,and Robin Knox Johnson.A more recent arrival than those when merchant ships first used the Hamble River for trade was when Chay Blyth return to the Hamble after his single handed circumnavigation of the world in 1971.It was a very busy day for everyone on the river,and it is estimated that the Hamble-Warsash ferry ferry carried 1500 passengers that day.
HAMBLE QUAY & FORESHORE. Although the Quay (or hard as it is more commonly known) is now concreted with a carpark it has always been open
